>urned to repression of women, I agree with you here, but more

messages.subject: RE: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] How topics evolve -was- Our Bodies
messages.msgSnippet: Nanci, I didn t meant hat it was bizarre taht the conversation had urned to repression of women, I agree with you here, but more how strange and wonderful it
messages.messageBody:
Nanci, I didn't meant hat it was bizarre taht the conversation had
urned to repression of women, I agree with you here, but more
how strange and wonderful it was that like-minded sould were
having the same kinds of thoughts at the same time. You know
what I mean?

Tracy

On 23 Aug 2000, at 9:47, Nanci and Thomas Kuykendall wrote:


And it's funny how topics converge, but on another
list, a vitriolc discussion of religion has turned,
slowly, to a commentary on repression of women! How
bizarre!
>
>Tracy

Not when you consider the track record of many of the
worlds religions in their treatment of women!! I find
that makes a lot of sense as a topic evolution,
actually.

Nanci K.

messages.subject: RE: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] How topics evolve -was- Our Bodies
messages.msgSnippet: And it s funny how topics converge, but on another list, a vitriolc discussion of religion has turned, slowly, to a commentary on repression of women!  How
messages.messageBody:
And it's funny how topics converge, but on another list, a vitriolc discussion of religion has turned, slowly, to a commentary on repression of women! How bizarre!
>
>Tracy

Not when you consider the track record of many of the worlds religions in their treatment of women!! I find that makes a lot of sense as a topic evolution, actually.

Nanci K.
